templates.name: Pfitzinger/Douglas Up to 55 Miles/Week Marathon Plan
templates.author: Pete Pfitzinger and Scott Douglas
templates.source_reference: Pfitzinger/Douglas Up to 55 Miles/Week Marathon Plan - 18-week schedule
templates.description: Science-based marathon training with periodized mesocycles emphasizing lactate threshold development, VO2max work, and marathon-specific preparation. Up to 55 miles/week peak weekly volume.

prerequisites: Experience with tempo runs and intervals
Able to handle prescribed weekly mileage

program_structure.training_philosophy: Periodized approach with four distinct mesocycles building aerobic capacity, lactate threshold, and race-specific fitness

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 1 - Endurance
mesocycles.focus: Building aerobic base, introducing speedwork with strides and VO2max intervals

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 2 - Lactate Threshold + Endurance
mesocycles.focus: Developing lactate threshold with sustained tempo efforts at 15K-Half Marathon pace

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 3 - Race Preparation
mesocycles.focus: Marathon-specific work with long runs including marathon pace segments and dress rehearsals

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 4 - Taper and Race
mesocycles.focus: Reduced volume with intensity maintenance, final sharpening, and race execution

program_structure.typical_week: 7 days structured with 2-3 quality sessions (Tuesday/Thursday), long run Sunday, recovery/aerobic runs filling remaining days

key_principles: Progressive overload with strategic recovery weeks
Lactate threshold development as primary physiological adaptation
VO2max intervals for speed and running economy
Marathon-pace segments integrated into long runs
Undulating volume pattern rather than linear progression
Recovery runs kept truly easy to enable quality sessions
workout_priorities: Long runs (primary weekly stimulus)
Lactate threshold workouts (tempo runs, cruise intervals)
VO2max intervals (5K pace work)
Marathon-pace runs (race-specific preparation)
General aerobic runs with optional strides
Recovery runs (active recovery between quality sessions)

pace_guidance.recovery_pace: Easy conversational effort, comfortable and relaxed
pace_guidance.general_aerobic_pace: Comfortable aerobic pace, slightly faster than recovery but still conversational
pace_guidance.medium_long_run_pace: Steady aerobic effort, moderate comfort level
pace_guidance.long_run_pace: Sustainable aerobic pace with marathon pace segments as prescribed
pace_guidance.lactate_threshold_pace: 15K to Half Marathon race pace - comfortably hard, sustainable for 20-30 minutes
pace_guidance.vo2max_pace: 5K race pace - hard effort, sustainable for 3-5 minute intervals
pace_guidance.strides: Fast but controlled, 20-30 seconds at approximately mile race pace

workout_notation.distance_format: Total distance includes warm-up/cooldown (e.g., '10 mi (16 km) w/ 5 mi @ LT pace' = warm-up + 5mi tempo + cooldown)
workout_notation.interval_format: '5 × 600 m @ 5K pace, jog 50-90% interval time between' means 5 repeats of 600m at 5K race pace with recovery jog
pace_references: '@ 5K pace' or '@ 5K race pace' = VO2max intensity
'@ 15K to half marathon pace' = Lactate threshold range
'@ marathon pace' or '@ marathon race pace' = Goal race pace
'jog 50 to 90% interval time between' = Recovery as percentage of work interval
workout_notation.strides_notation: 'w/ 8 × 100 m strides' means 8 repetitions of 100m at fast controlled pace, '+ strides' typically means 4-8 × 100m
workout_notation.recovery_format: Recovery intervals prescribed as percentage of work time (e.g., jog 50-90% of interval duration)

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Lactate threshold: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 4 mi. (6 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
weekly_schedule.saturday: Recovery + speed: 5 mi. (8 km) w/ 10 × 100 m strides

weekly_schedule.tuesday: General aerobic + speed: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 10 × 100 m strides
weekly_schedule.thursday: Lactate threshold: 8 mi. (14 km) w/ 4 mi. @ 15K to half marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: General aerobic + speed: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 10 × 100 m strides
General aerobic + speed: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 8 mi. (13 km)
weekly_schedule.thursday: Lactate threshold: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 5 mi. @ 15K to half marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Lactate threshold: 9 mi. (14 km) w/ 5 mi. (8 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
Lactate threshold: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 6 mi. (10 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
Lactate threshold: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 5 × 1 mi. (2 km) @ 15K to half marathon pace
General aerobic + speed: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 8 × 100 m strides
weekly_schedule.sunday: Marathon-long run: 18 mi. (29 km) w/ 10 mi. (16 km) @ marathon pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Recovery 6 mi. (10 km)
Lactate threshold: 11 mi. (18 km) w/ 7 mi. (12 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
VO2max: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 5 × 600 m @ 5K race pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
VO2max: 9 mi. (14 km) w/ 5 × 800 m @ 5K pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
weekly_schedule.sunday: Marathon-pace run: 18 mi. (29 km) w/ 14 mi. (23 km) @ marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Lactate threshold: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 5K race pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
General aerobic + speed: 8 mi. (13 km) w/ 8 × 100 m strides
weekly_schedule.sunday: Marathon-pace run: 19 mi. (31 km) w/ 12 mi. (19 km) @ marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: VO2max: 9 mi. (14 km) w/ 6 × 600 m @ 5K pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
Dress rehearsal: 9 mi. (14 km) w/ 2 mi. (3 km) @ marathon race pace
weekly_schedule.sunday: Marathon-pace run: 13 mi. (21 km) w/ 8 mi. (13 km) @ marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: VO2max: 7 mi. (12 km) w/ 5 × 400 m @ 5K race pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between

templates.name: Pfitzinger/Douglas 70-85 Miles/Week Marathon Plan
templates.author: Pete Pfitzinger and Scott Douglas
templates.description: Science-based marathon training with periodized mesocycles emphasizing lactate threshold development, VO2max work, and marathon-specific preparation. 70-85 miles/week peak weekly volume.

prerequisites: Strong aerobic base with consistent 60+ mile weeks
Extensive experience with tempo runs and intervals
Able to handle high weekly mileage

program_structure.training_philosophy: High-volume periodized approach with four distinct mesocycles building aerobic capacity, lactate threshold, and race-specific fitness

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 1 - Endurance
mesocycles.focus: Building aerobic base with high volume, introducing speedwork

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 2 - Lactate Threshold + Endurance
mesocycles.focus: Extensive lactate threshold development with sustained tempo efforts

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 3 - Race Preparation
mesocycles.focus: Marathon-specific work with long runs including substantial marathon pace segments

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 4 - Taper and Race
mesocycles.focus: Reduced volume with intensity maintenance, final sharpening, and race execution

program_structure.typical_week: 7 days structured with 2-3 quality sessions, long run Sunday, recovery/aerobic runs filling remaining days

key_principles: High volume progressive overload with strategic recovery weeks
Lactate threshold development as primary physiological adaptation
VO2max intervals for speed and running economy
Marathon-pace segments integrated into long runs
Undulating volume pattern rather than linear progression
Recovery runs kept truly easy to enable quality sessions
workout_priorities: Long runs (primary weekly stimulus)
Lactate threshold workouts (tempo runs, cruise intervals)
VO2max intervals (5K pace work)
Marathon-pace runs (race-specific preparation)
General aerobic runs with optional strides
Recovery runs (active recovery between quality sessions)

pace_guidance.recovery_pace: Easy conversational effort, comfortable and relaxed
pace_guidance.general_aerobic_pace: Comfortable aerobic pace, slightly faster than recovery but still conversational
pace_guidance.medium_long_run_pace: Steady aerobic effort, moderate comfort level
pace_guidance.long_run_pace: Sustainable aerobic pace with marathon pace segments as prescribed
pace_guidance.lactate_threshold_pace: 15K to Half Marathon race pace - comfortably hard, sustainable for 20-30 minutes
pace_guidance.vo2max_pace: 5K race pace - hard effort, sustainable for 3-5 minute intervals
pace_guidance.strides: Fast but controlled, 20-30 seconds at approximately mile race pace

workout_notation.interval_format: Recovery prescribed as percentage of work interval time
pace_references: '@ 15K to half marathon pace' = Lactate threshold range
workout_notation.strides_notation: 'w/ 8 × 100 m strides' means 8 repetitions of 100m at fast controlled pace
workout_notation.recovery_format: 'jog 50 to 90% interval time between' = Recovery as percentage of work time

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Lactate threshold: 11 mi. (18 km) w/ 4 mi. (6 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace w/ 4 mi. (6 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
General aerobic + speed: 11 mi. (18 km) w/ 10 × 100 m strides
Lactate threshold: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 5 mi. @ 15K to half marathon race pace
General aerobic + speed: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 4 mi. (6 km) @ 10 × 100 m strides
Lactate threshold: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 5 mi. @ 15K to half marathon race pace
Lactate threshold: 12 mi. (19 km) w/ 6 mi. (10 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
Lactate threshold: 11 mi. (18 km) w/ 5 × 1 mi. (2 km) @ 15K to half marathon pace
Medium-long run: 15 mi. (24 km)
weekly_schedule.sunday: Marathon-pace run: 24 mi. (39 km) w/ 16 mi. (26 km) @ marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Recovery 7 mi. (12 km)
Lactate threshold: 13 mi. (21 km) w/ 8 mi. (13 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
VO2max: 9 mi. (14 km) w/ 5 × 600 m @ 5K race pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
VO2max: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 5 × 1,000 m @ 5K pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
weekly_schedule.sunday: Marathon-pace run: 22 mi. (35 km) w/ 18 mi. (29 km) @ marathon race pace

weekly_schedule.tuesday: Lactate threshold: 11 mi. (18 km) w/ 6 mi. (10 km) @ 15K to half marathon race pace
General aerobic + speed: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 8 × 100 m strides

weekly_schedule.tuesday: VO2max: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 6 × 800 m @ 5K pace, jog 50 to 90% interval time between
Dress rehearsal: 10 mi. (16 km) w/ 2 mi. (3 km) @ marathon race pace
weekly_schedule.sunday: Medium-long run: 14 mi. (23 km) w/ 8 mi. (13 km) @ marathon race pace

templates.name: Pfitzinger/Douglas 85+ Miles/Week Marathon Plan
templates.author: Pete Pfitzinger and Scott Douglas
templates.description: Elite-level science-based marathon training with periodized mesocycles emphasizing lactate threshold development, VO2max work, and marathon-specific preparation. 85+ miles/week peak weekly volume for experienced competitive marathoners.

prerequisites: Very strong aerobic base with consistent 70+ mile weeks
Running 6-7 days per week for extended period
Extensive experience with tempo runs and intervals
Proven ability to handle very high weekly mileage
Excellent injury resistance and recovery capacity

program_structure.training_philosophy: Elite-level periodized approach with four distinct mesocycles building exceptional aerobic capacity, lactate threshold, and race-specific fitness at very high volumes

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 1 - Endurance
mesocycles.focus: Building massive aerobic base with very high volume, introducing speedwork

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 2 - Lactate Threshold + Endurance
mesocycles.focus: Extensive lactate threshold development with sustained high-volume tempo efforts

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 3 - Race Preparation
mesocycles.focus: Marathon-specific work with very long runs including substantial marathon pace segments

mesocycles.name: Mesocycle 4 - Taper and Race
mesocycles.focus: Reduced volume with intensity maintenance, final sharpening, and race execution

program_structure.typical_week: 7 days structured with 2-3 quality sessions, long run Sunday, recovery/aerobic runs throughout

key_principles: Very high volume progressive overload with strategic recovery weeks
Lactate threshold development as primary physiological adaptation
VO2max intervals for speed and running economy
Marathon-pace segments integrated into very long runs
Undulating volume pattern rather than linear progression
Recovery runs kept truly easy despite high weekly volume
Elite-level volume demands exceptional attention to recovery, nutrition, and injury prevention
workout_priorities: Long runs (primary weekly stimulus)
Lactate threshold workouts (tempo runs, cruise intervals)
VO2max intervals (5K pace work)
Marathon-pace runs (race-specific preparation)
General aerobic runs with optional strides
Recovery runs (active recovery between quality sessions)

pace_guidance.recovery_pace: Easy conversational effort, comfortable and relaxed
pace_guidance.general_aerobic_pace: Comfortable aerobic pace, slightly faster than recovery but still conversational
pace_guidance.medium_long_run_pace: Steady aerobic effort, moderate comfort level
pace_guidance.long_run_pace: Sustainable aerobic pace with marathon pace segments as prescribed
pace_guidance.lactate_threshold_pace: 15K to Half Marathon race pace - comfortably hard, sustainable for 20-30 minutes
pace_guidance.vo2max_pace: 5K race pace - hard effort, sustainable for 3-5 minute intervals
pace_guidance.strides: Fast but controlled, 20-30 seconds at approximately mile race pace

workout_notation.interval_format: Recovery prescribed as percentage of work interval time
pace_references: '@ 15K to half marathon pace' = Lactate threshold range
workout_notation.strides_notation: 'w/ 8 × 100 m strides' means 8 repetitions of 100m at fast controlled pace
workout_notation.recovery_format: 'jog 50 to 90% interval time between' = Recovery as percentage of work time
